title: Duke Nukem 1, 2, 3D, Manhattan Project (MAC OS X - GOG)
description:
DUKE NUKEM COLLECTION (MAC OS X):

DRM-free GOG versions.

DUKE NUKEM 1 
DUKE NUKEM 2
DUKE NUKEM 3D: ATOMIC EDITION
DUKE NUKEM: MANHATTAN PROJECT

MINIMUM SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: 

OS X 10.6.8 or later. 
Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo 2GHz+ 
Memory: 1GB of RAM 
Graphics: 64MB of video memory 
Recommended two-button mouse, 
or Apple mouse with Secondary Button / Secondary Click enabled.

INCLUDED BONUS CONTENT:

Duke Nukem 1 + 2: Duke Nukem 1 hintsheet, Duke Nukem 2 manual.
Duke Nukem 2 soundtrack

Duke Nukem 3D: manual, 20 artworks, 2 HD wallpapers, avatar, 
113 Duke ringtones

Duke Nukem - Manhattan Project: manual, 113 Duke ringtones

*******************

DUKE NUKEM 1 + 2

Genre: action / arcade / platformer
Release Date: July 1, 1991
Game Modes: single player

What's cool about it:

Run-n-gun through 3 action-packed episodes in Duke Nukem, and 4 
explosive episodes in Duke Nukem 2!

Witness the makings of a true gaming legend!

Over 30 levels of heavy-duty run-and-gun shoot-and-forget 2D 
platforming fun!

Overview:

Duke Nukem
Every great hero has a humble beginning. Go back to the very roots 
of the King of Badassery, Duke Nukem. YouÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been called on a top 
secret mission to save the world from the brilliantly evil Dr. Proton 
and his Techbot army! Originally conceived as three seperate episodes, 
Duke Nukem will take you all the way through a demolished city, a 
secret moonbase, and, finally, the very future of Earth itself! Are 
you man enough to step into the butt-kicking boots of Duke Nukem?

Duke Nukem 2
After a triumphant return from the previous assignment, our main man 
Duke decides to write a book (Ã¢â‚¬Å“Why IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m So Great") in his spare time 
and take some well-deserved time off. Our heroÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s rest and book tour 
was not meant to last for too long, though. He got snatched by alien 
invaders right in the middle of a TV interview! The plan was as simple 
as it was devious: turn Duke into a zombie using the Encephalosucker 
and take over the world! Get out of the alien-infested jail and kick 
those slimy alien butts back to whence they came!

******************

DUKE NUKEM 3D: ATOMIC EDITION

Genre: shooter / fpp / sci-fi
Release Date: January 29, 1996
Language: English
Game Modes: single player, multiplayer

What's cool about it:

The most legendary first person perspective shooter featuring Duke 
Nukem, one of the most iconic characters of all time
    
Memorable, cheesy, and just plain awesome one-liners
    
A wide variety of weapons, including the Shrink Ray and DukeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s 
Mighty Foot

Overview:

Duke Nukem, the politically incorrect celebrity and ultimate alien ass
kicker, defends Earth and its babes from alien invasion.

He is a can-do hero who realizes that sometimes innocent people have to 
die in order to save Earth, so accuracy of gun fire is not a real concern 
to him. This is the award-winning game that helped define the FPS genre 
and introduced unparalleled interactivity and a talking main character.

Take the fight to the aliens in Hollywood, Los Angeles, a moon base and 
alien spacecraft. Defeat the aliens, so Duke can get back to some R&R with 
a stogie, a warm belly and a bottle of Jack.

Duke Nukem 3D: Atomic Edition is the DRM-Free version of this legendary 
shooter. It includes the fourth bonus episode, a new weapon, and enemies. 
On top of that, we give you over a 100 free Duke Nukem 3D ringtones, 
as an extra bonus!

*******************

DUKE NUKEM: MANHATTAN PROJECT

Genre: action / adventure / platformer
Release Date: May 14, 2002
Language: English
Game Modes: single player

What's cool about it:

Bombs, gibs, babes and a whole lot of shooting
    
Duke is back with even more ass-kicking awesome one-liners!
    
An intense, fast-paced, action-packed arcade experience

Overview:

Gaming's king of action returns in an all new adventure, this time in New 
York City. Duke battles his way across towering skyscraper rooftops and 
through gritty subway stations, hunting for a power-hungry villain, Mech 
Morphix. Mutants of every kind are thrown at Duke as he chases down Morphix 
through eight huge environments and avoids the green slime called GLOPP which 
is causing all the chaos.

But radioactive slime isn't Duke's only problem - there are more than 25 
uniquely dangerous mutated enemies hell-bent on making a meal of him. Whether 
it's Uzi-sporting alligators or ten-foot tall roach beasts - Duke's in town to 
blast the bad guys and save the chicks. Sure, pipe bombs, a machine gun, a 
rocket launcher and a pulse cannon are going to make a goo-filled mess in the 
Big Apple, but what's a hero to do?
